studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: AAJT-S Treatment
arms.description: Application of the AAJT-S device over the upper abdomen (inflated to 250 mmHg) to achieve temporary aortic occlusion for ≤60 minutes for control of refractory postpartum haemorrhage

eligibilityCriteria.name: Primary PPH with significant blood loss

objectives.name: Primary Objective - Safety and Efficacy Assessment
objectives.text: To assess whether the AAJT-S device can temporarily and safely control severe PPH in a resource-limited, high-risk setting.

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Feasibility Assessment
objectives.text: To describe feasibility of AAJT-S deployment by obstetric teams.

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Hemodynamic Stabilization
objectives.text: To evaluate maternal hemodynamic stabilization and procedural outcomes.

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Complication Monitoring
objectives.text: To monitor for short- and long-term complications (thrombosis, ischemia, infection, renal dysfunction).

endpoints.name: Primary Endpoint - Temporary Control of Severe PPH
endpoints.text: Successful temporary and safe control of severe postpartum haemorrhage using AAJT-S device

endpoints.name: Feasibility of AAJT-S Deployment
endpoints.text: Feasibility of AAJT-S deployment by obstetric teams

endpoints.name: Maternal Hemodynamic Stabilization
endpoints.text: Maternal hemodynamic stabilization following AAJT-S application

endpoints.name: Procedural Outcomes
endpoints.text: Procedural outcomes including device application duration and subsequent surgical interventions

endpoints.name: Thrombosis Complications
endpoints.text: Incidence of thrombosis as short- and long-term complication

endpoints.name: Ischemia Complications
endpoints.text: Incidence of ischemia as short- and long-term complication

endpoints.name: Infection Complications
endpoints.text: Incidence of infection as short- and long-term complication

endpoints.name: Renal Dysfunction
endpoints.text: Incidence of renal dysfunction as short- and long-term complication

studyInterventions.name: AAJT-S
studyInterventions.description: Abdominal Aortic and Junctional Tourniquet – Stabilized device for temporary aortic occlusion to control severe postpartum haemorrhage

studyInterventions.description: Standard uterotonic therapy for initial PPH management

studyInterventions.name: Tranexamic acid
studyInterventions.description: Antifibrinolytic agent for initial PPH management

studyInterventions.name: Uterine balloon tamponade
studyInterventions.description: Mechanical intervention for initial PPH management

titles.text: Temporary Aortic Occlusion with the Abdominal Tourniquet for Refractory Postpartum Haemorrhage: A Proof-of-Concept Study in a War-Affected Region

indications.name: Refractory Postpartum Haemorrhage
indications.description: Primary PPH with blood loss >1000 mL refractory to uterotonics and uterine balloon tamponade due to uterine atony

study.name: Temporary Aortic Occlusion with the Abdominal Tourniquet for Refractory Postpartum Haemorrhage: A Proof-of-Concept Study in a War-Affected Region

abbreviations.expandedText: Abdominal Aortic and Junctional Tourniquet – Stabilized

studyDefinitionDocument.name: Temporary Aortic Occlusion with the Abdominal Tourniquet for Refractory Postpartum Haemorrhage: A Proof-of-Concept Study in a War-Affected Region

procedures.name: Uterine Massage
procedures.label: Uterine Massage
procedures.description: Manual massage of the uterus to stimulate contraction and reduce bleeding

code.decode: Unlisted procedure, maternity care and delivery

procedures.name: Uterine Balloon Tamponade
procedures.label: Balloon Tamponade
procedures.description: Insertion of intrauterine balloon to apply pressure and control postpartum hemorrhage

code.decode: Unlisted procedure, maternity care and delivery

procedures.name: Aortic Occlusion
procedures.label: Temporary Aortic Occlusion
procedures.description: Application of external aortic compression device over upper abdomen inflated to 250 mmHg for up to 60 minutes to achieve temporary aortic occlusion

procedures.name: Compression Sutures
procedures.label: Uterine Compression Sutures
procedures.description: Surgical placement of compression sutures on uterus to control bleeding

procedures.name: Artery Ligation
procedures.label: Uterine Artery Ligation
procedures.description: Surgical ligation of arteries to control postpartum hemorrhage

procedures.name: Pelvic Ultrasound
procedures.label: Pelvic Ultrasound
procedures.description: Pelvic ultrasound imaging performed at 6 and 12 months postpartum for follow-up assessment

code.decode: Ultrasound, pelvic, nonobstetric, real-time with image documentation

procedures.name: Inpatient Daily Assessment
procedures.label: Daily Clinical Assessment
procedures.description: Daily clinical assessments performed during inpatient stay for monitoring complications

procedures.name: Phone Monitoring
procedures.label: Post-Discharge Phone Follow-up
procedures.description: Telephone monitoring of patients following hospital discharge

medicalDevices.name: AAJT-S
medicalDevices.label: Abdominal Aortic and Junctional Tourniquet - Stabilized
medicalDevices.description: External aortic compression device applied over upper abdomen and inflated to 250 mmHg to achieve temporary aortic occlusion for hemorrhage control

medicalDevices.name: Uterine Balloon Tamponade Device
medicalDevices.label: Intrauterine Balloon
medicalDevices.description: Balloon device inserted into uterus to apply pressure and control postpartum hemorrhage

medicalDevices.name: Ultrasound Device
medicalDevices.label: Pelvic Ultrasound Equipment
medicalDevices.description: Diagnostic imaging equipment for pelvic ultrasound examinations

conditions.name: Blood Loss Threshold for AAJT-S Deployment
conditions.description: Ongoing bleeding threshold requiring AAJT-S intervention
conditions.text: Ongoing bleeding >1000 mL despite standard therapy

conditions.name: Primary PPH Blood Loss Criterion
conditions.text: Primary PPH with blood loss >1000 mL

conditions.name: Refractory to Standard Treatment
conditions.text: Refractory to uterotonics and uterine balloon tamponade

conditions.name: Bleeding Control Success
conditions.description: Primary outcome criterion for successful intervention
conditions.text: Control of bleeding within 2 minutes after AAJT-S application

transitionRules.name: Standard PPH Management to AAJT-S Deployment
transitionRules.text: AAJT-S deployed in case of ongoing bleeding >1000 mL after standard therapy (oxytocin, misoprostol, methylergometrine, tranexamic acid, uterine massage, balloon tamponade)

transitionRules.name: AAJT-S to Device Deflation
transitionRules.text: Device monitored and deflated after stabilization or readiness for surgery

transitionRules.name: Transition to Surgical Treatment
transitionRules.text: Surgical treatment (compression sutures, artery ligation) performed if bleeding resumed

transitionRules.name: Inpatient to Post-Discharge Follow-up
transitionRules.text: Transition from inpatient daily assessments to phone monitoring post-discharge

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Completion of all protocol-required visits including 12-month pelvic ultrasound follow-up

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Inability to Provide Consent
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Exclusion due to inability to provide informed consent

analysisPopulations.name: Full Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.label: FAS
analysisPopulations.description: All patients who received AAJT-S for refractory PPH

analysisPopulations.name: Safety Population
analysisPopulations.label: Safety
analysisPopulations.description: Identical to FAS; all patients who underwent device placement and were monitored until discharge
analysisPopulations.criteria: Underwent device placement and were monitored until discharge

characteristics.name: Gestational Age at delivery
characteristics.description: Gestational age at delivery in weeks and days

documentContentReferences.description: Reference to blood loss threshold >1000 mL from Section 4 Inclusion Criteria

commentAnnotations.text: AAJT-S (Abdominal Aortic and Junctional Tourniquet – Stabilized) is an FDA-approved device for temporary aortic occlusion in trauma
AAJT-S used off-label with oral informed consent
Device inflated to 250 mmHg to achieve temporary aortic occlusion for ≤60 minutes

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Initial protocol version approved by Olexandrivska Hospital Ethics Committee (Approval number: 2024/EC/128094)
